event.title: <show-title>Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Who says a sewer party can’t be a great time?
event.description: Cowabunga dudes! It’s time for a radical Movie Party celebrating one of the most righteous reptiles ever put to film – the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles! We’re headed to the sewers for interactive games, crafting your own ninja stars (to be thrown at watermelons after the show only), and themed props like ninja masks, finger skateboards, green ooze, and more. It’s probably the coolest way possible to watch your favorite karate reptiles kick some mutant butt. Your ticket includes the movie, the activities, and the props. Be sure to arrive up to 30 minutes early to give yourself plenty of time to get in on the fun.

show.title: Good Burger
show.headline: Just two guys being dudes

event.title: <show-title>Good Burger</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Home of the Good Burger, can we take your order?
event.description:
Whether you’re a dude, a dude, or a dude, (aren’t we all?) our GOOD BURGER Movie Party is for you. We’re celebrating this essential ‘90s classic with plenty of interactive fun and themed props, including paper hats, hamburger stress relievers, plenty of Secret Sauce (aka orange slime), and much more.

Hitting screens faster than an order of Nickelodeon Magazine, GOOD BURGER embodies the workplace hangout vibes of the ‘70s and slobs vs. snobs ethos of ‘80s comedies into the most offbeat buddy comedy of the ‘90s. Ed works for Good Burger, whose cross-street rivals Mondo Burger are dead-set on taking them out of business; Dexter reluctantly takes a summer job to pay off a debt, turning Ed’s secret sauce into a path to success. Crucially featuring Shaquille O’Neal (not as Kazaam), Sinbad (not as Shazaam), Parliament’s George Clinton, and the late, great Abe Vigoda. (Jake Isgar)

Newly-created DCP courtesy of Paramount Pictures

event.title: <show-title>Bottoms</show-title> <event-type-title>Advance Screening w/Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: See our new Drafthouse Recommends before anyone else with a live Q&A
event.description: We’re so excited to share our new Drafthouse Recommends, BOTTOMS, with all of you, so we’re hosting a special Advance Screening to help you see it as early as possible. Stars Ayo Edebiri and Rachel Sennott will even be joining us for a live conversation about all the hard-hitting, raunchy shenanigans. Seating is limited so reserve tickets while you can, and be sure to check out our blog to learn more about why we consider BOTTOMS to be one of the best films of the year.

show.title: Past Lives
show.headline: An airy, romantic, & heart-breaking Drafthouse Recommends from Celine Song

show.title: Grease
show.headline: Summer lovin' lives on in this quintessential movie musical celebrating the '50s

event.title: <show-title>Grease</show-title> <event-type-title>Sing-Along Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Haven't you heard? GREASE is the word
event.description:
We’re hopelessly devoted to GREASE, with its lovable characters, doo-wop style, and, of course, those endlessly catchy tunes. To celebrate this timeless classic, we’re putting together an interactive, prop-filled, hand-jiving Sing-Along Movie Party for all you T-Birds and Pink Ladies out there (beauty school dropouts also welcome).

We’ll kick things off with a pre-show hand jive contest before we start the interactive show, where you’ll have some candy cigarettes to help you look like a greaser, a comb so that you can comb-along to the action, ribbon wands, salon caps, and more. And because this is a Sing-Along, we’ll have the lyrics up onscreen to help every Danny, Sandy, Rizzo, and Kenickie in the audience get in on the fun.

So roll up the cuffs on those jeans, grab your respective black leather and pink satin jackets, theatrically comb your hair, and cruise on down to join us for the most rockin’ Sing-Along Movie Party ever.

DCP courtesy of Paramount Pictures

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Grease Sing Along Web SHOW Hero 1920x1080 v3

posterImage.altText: Grease Sing Along Web SHOW P 960x1400

show.title: Shrek 2
show.headline: Once upon another time...

event.title: <show-title>Shrek 2</show-title> <event-type-title>Swamp Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Once upon another time…we partied!
event.description: Somebody once told me that when Far Far Away needed a hero, one man…er, ogre…answered the call to glory. That man was Shrek, and we’re celebrating his triumphant second adventure with our SHREK 2 Swamp Party! Much like ogres, this screening has layers to it, including games, interactive fun, and themed props like an onion keychain, medieval meal box, ogre ears, and your very own fairy wand (to be used RESPONSIBLY). So grab your best friends, get on your noble steed, and join us as our favorite green hero saves the day, again.

show.title: Tokyo Pop
show.headline: A woman spontaneously moves to Japan to become a rock star

event.title: <show-title>Tokyo Pop</show-title> <event-type-title>Karaoke Party Bar Event</event-type-title>
event.headline: 4k restoration followed by karaoke at Video Vortex
event.description: We've got you covered with our Tokyo Pop Karaoke Takeover celebrating the release of a new restoration of TOKYO POP, an '80s indie gem about an American woman who travels to Japan to follow her dream of being a singer, directed by Fran Rubel Kuzui (BUFFY THE VAMPIRE SLAYER). Before you down a Toki Highball (or three) for courage, see the movie, then come down to Video Vortex to belt out one of the featured songs for prizes & karaoke glory. Enter to win tickets to any movie at Alamo Drafthouse, plus buttons featuring original artwork for TOKYO POP by Keith Haring, posters, Blu-rays, and more courtesy of our friends at Kino Lorber!

show.title: Barbie
show.headline: Live the Barbie life with exclusive collectibles, photo ops, & more

event.title: <show-title>Barbie</show-title> <event-type-title>Party Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Do you have what it takes to party like Barbie?
event.description: Don’t you wish the real world was a little more like Barbieland? Where every day is a party and every movie is filled with Barbies and Kens as passionate about Barbie as you are? So do we, which is why we’re bringing a little of that Barbieland magic to the real world for a Barbie fan’s dream show – our exclusive, interactive BARBIE Party. We’ll have themed props, interactive fun, and a special pink cocktail available to order. It’s the neon pink, super fun BARBIE show you’ve been dreaming of since you were 5 years old.

eventType.description: From STAR WARS-themed milkshakes to twelve-hour LORD OF THE RINGS marathon feasts, our chefs whip up movie-inspired specials that’s like nothing else you’ve ever experienced.

show.title: Drop Dead Gorgeous
show.headline: It's really about America

event.title: <show-title>Drop Dead Gorgeous</show-title>
event.headline: It’s really about America, and champagne
event.description:
What do you get when you mix the absurdity of The State with the status-hungry sociopathy of teen beauty pageants? If KIND HEARTS AND CORONETS had a riot-grrl soundtrack and an abundance of home-sewn culottes, it might look a little something like Michael Patrick Jan's DROP DEAD GORGEOUS. Raise a glass with us as we celebrate this unique example of ‘90s excellence – with plenty of champagne available to order.

Ten of Mount Rose, Minnesota's brightest young things are competing for the title of Miss American Teen Princess, but when the contestants begin to drop dead (albeit gorgeously), the dark underbelly of a perky American tradition is exposed. Released in 1999 to surprisingly little fanfare, this mockumentary send-up of small-town ambition pits queen bee Denise Richards against trailer park princess Kirsten Dunst, Broadway baby Brittany Murphy, and a thirsty young Amy Adams (her debut!) in a test of wit, grit, and baton-twirling.

Newly-created DCP courtesy of Warner Bros.

show.title: Good Mythical Evening 2023
show.headline: Good Mythical Evening: Pain or Pleasure? You Decide.

event.title: <show-title>Good Mythical Evening 2023</show-title>
event.headline: Good Mythical Evening: Pain or Pleasure? You Decide.
event.description: It's that time of year again – when Mythicality gets R-rated – with a brand new uncensored, drunken installment of Good Mythical Evening. But this time, the fate of Rhett & Link's night is in your hands. Will it be an event marked with unprecedented pain or magnificent pleasure? Kinky! Join Rhett, Link, and the Mythical Crew for Good Mythical Evening: Pain or Pleasure? You Decide. And for the first time ever, you can enjoy the show at participating Alamo Drafthouse theaters with fellow Mythical Beasts! Tickets and details below. For Mature Audiences Only (18 years and older).

eventType.title: Special Event
eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers
eventType.description: Whether it’s a movie-inspired feast, an interactive party, or a screening paired with a live performance, we love sharing the movies we love in new and exciting ways.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, kids menus, and a free prize for kids 12 and under. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Brunch
sessionAttributes.description: Both our regular and Brunch menus are available at this screening. Arrive hungry.

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.

formats.title: 2D Digital
formats.headline: Digital format projected using a digital projector.
formats.description: Digital format projected using a digital projector.

formats.title: 3D Digital
formats.headline: All the digitalness of the Digital 2D format, but with an extra dimension!
formats.description: All the digitalness of the Digital 2D format, but with an extra dimension!

formats.title: 35mm
formats.headline: Film print projected using film projectors.
formats.description: The industry standard for theatrical film releases prior to digital cinema. Film print projected using film projectors.

formats.title: Open Caption
formats.headline: Captioning will be displayed on the screen for the duration of the show.
formats.description: Captioning will be displayed on the screen for the duration of the show.

agePolicies.name: !!DO NOT USE!! All Ages
agePolicies.description: All ages will be allowed at all screenings of this show.

agePolicies.name: Rated G
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG-13 (Standard)
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG with Adult Focus
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated R
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
